title: Single of The Week: Modeselektor- Let Your Love Grow
body:
[![](http://admin.crackintheroad.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/08/MODESELEKTOR_By_Birgit_Kaulfuss_2-740x493.jpg "MODESELEKTOR_By_Birgit_Kaulfuss_2")](http://admin.crackintheroad.com/music/2289-single-of-the-week-modeselektor-let-your-love-grow/attachment/modeselektor_by_birgit_kaulfuss_2)

The story of **Modeselektor** is a one of name changes and collaborations. Since the release of the Berlin duo’s first album in 2005, _‘Hello Mom!’_ the techno duo have been going from strength to strength, collaborating with **Thom Yorke** and **Maxïmo Park** for their second LP _‘Happy Birthday!’_ Full of absorbing grooves and a sly sense of humour, the record had any electronic music fan on his knees in appreciation.

Although undoubtedly rooted in techno, _‘Happy Birthday!’_ had an altogether more ambient sound. _‘Let your love grow’_ was a great example of this, perfect in pacing and delicately produced; the tune is a delight. This is why over three years later it’s our record of the week.

[Check Out Modeselektor’s Myspace](http://www.myspace.com/mdslktr)
